p: Influenza A virus (IAV) hijacks the host protein synthesis machinery to express its proteins and prevents this machinery from being blocked by cytoplasmic stress granule formation thanks to the viral nonstructural protein 1 (NS1) [ 39]. Stress granules are composed of mRNAs, translation initiation complexes and other RNA-binding proteins that can redirect translation following a stress. They can be induced by eIF4A inhibitors such as flavaglines [ 40]. McCormick and collaborators showed that silvestrol induces the formation of stress granules in several cell lines leading to an inhibition of viral protein accumulation and genome replication [ 12].
